DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Imetelstat sodium works by blocking the activity of an enzyme called telomerase, which is found at high levels in cells that divide rapidly, including cancer cells. Blocking this enzyme keeps cancer cells from dividing and causes them to die. Imetelstat sodiumÂ is a type of targeted therapy called an enzyme inhibitor.
DrugInfoMetaData.FDAExternalRef: FDA label information for this drug is available at DailyMed.

Para.ExternalRef: FDA label information for this drug is available at DailyMed.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Imetelstat sodium is approved to treat:

ItemizedList.ListItem: Myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) that is low risk or intermediate-1 risk. It is used in adults who:have anemia that required blood transfusions of 4 or more red blood cell units over 8 weeks, andhave not responded to, have stopped responding to, or cannot be treated with an erythropoiesis-stimulating agent.

Section.Para: Imetelstat sodium is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.

Section.Para: Drugs are often studied to find out if they can help treat or prevent conditions other than the ones they are approved for. This patient information sheet applies only to approved uses of the drug. However, much of the information may also apply to unapproved uses that are being studied.

Section.Title: Clinical Trials Accepting Patients
Section.Para: Find Clinical Trials for Imetelstat Sodium - Check for trials from NCI's list of cancer clinical trials now accepting patients.

DrugInfoDisclaimer.Para: Important: The drug information on this page is meant to be educational. It is not a substitute for medical advice. The information may not cover all possible uses, actions, interactions, or side effects of this drug, or precautions to be taken while using it. Please see your health care professional for more information about your specific medical condition and the use of this drug.
